Class EyeChartHelper

    • EyeChartHelper

  • public class EyeChartHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    A Helper Class for CS For The Humanities Eye Chart Project.

      Return the nth most used element of the given array as a string in all capital letters, ignoring punctuation and given "boring" words.

    • Method Detail

      • getMostUsedWord

        public java.lang.String getMostUsedWord(java.lang.String[] x,
                                        java.lang.String[] boring,
                                        int n)
        Return the nth most used element of the given array as a string in all capital letters, ignoring punctuation and given "boring" words.
        Parameters:
        x - An array of strings; each element is considered as a single word.
        boring - An array of "boring" strings which will be ignored in the most used count.
        n - The desired frequency rank (greatest frequency begins at n = 0).
        Returns:
        The nth most common element of the array x.
        Since:
        1.0

      • scrubStringArray

        public java.lang.String[] scrubStringArray(java.lang.String[] x,
                                           java.lang.String[] y)
        Returns an array equivalent to a given array of strings with the exception of those elements which also appear in a secondary array of strings which are to be "removed" from the first array.
        Parameters:
        x - A String array from which a given set of words is to be removed.
        y - A String array of "words" to remove from the array x.
        Returns:
        An array containing all elements of x which do not appear in y.

        For the mathematically inclined, this is this is the set-theoretic compliment of y in x.

      • upperCaseArray

        public java.lang.String[] upperCaseArray(java.lang.String[] x)
        Returns an array of strings, all upper case, which is otherwise identical to the given array.
        Parameters:
        x - A string array.
        Returns:
        An array identical to x with the exception that all lowercase letters in each element of x have been replaced with upper case letters.

      • removeWord

        public java.lang.String[] removeWord(java.lang.String[] x,
                                     java.lang.String word)
        Returns a String array identical to a given String array with all instances of elements equivalent to a given string removed.
        Parameters:
        word - A string
        x - A String array from which all elements equivalent to word will be removed.
        Returns:
        A String array equivalent to x with all elements themselves equivalent to word removed.
